core_thesis.statement: Mathematics consists only of definitions and rational approximations
core_thesis.implication: Numbers like √2 and π don't exist - they are only definitions we approximate
core_thesis.foundation: At Planck scale (10^-35 m), space is discrete, only rationals possible

principle.name: Existence_Restriction
principle.statement: Only ℤ and ℚ exist as mathematical objects
principle.justification: Successor function gives ℤ, quotients give ℚ

principle.name: Definition_Without_Existence
principle.statement: We can define objects without claiming they exist
principle.example: √2 ≝ {x: x² = 2} defines sqrt(2) without asserting existence

principle.name: Rational_Approximation
principle.statement: All mathematics can be done via rational approximation
principle.example: π ≈_5 355/113 gives π accurate to 6 decimal places

principle.name: Planck_Discreteness
principle.statement: Physical space is discrete at fundamental scale
principle.consequence: Continuous real numbers cannot exist physically

claim.name: Godel_Resolution
claim.classical: Gödel: Some true statements are unprovable
claim.recursive: No incompleteness when we don't claim existence
claim.explanation: Incompleteness arises from existence claims we can't prove

claim.name: Continuum_Denial
claim.explanation: Between any two rationals, only finitely many Planck positions

examples.resolution: At Planck scale, motion is finite discrete jumps
No continuum means no pathological decomposition

philosophical_implications.implication: Math is a language for definitions, not discovery of eternal truths

connection_to_physics.quantum_mechanics: Energy levels are discrete, matching our discrete mathematics
connection_to_physics.planck_scale: Space-time quantization at 10^-35 m supports rational-only view
connection_to_physics.digital_physics: Universe may be computational, running on rational arithmetic

summary_for_paper.title: Recursive Constructive Mathematics: A Discrete Foundation
summary_for_paper.abstract: We propose that mathematics consists solely of definitions and rational approximations, with only integers and rationals having actual existence. This framework, justified by the discrete nature of spacetime at the Planck scale, resolves classical paradoxes including Gödel's incompleteness theorems by avoiding unprovable existence claims.
summary_for_paper.key_result: Every computable mathematical object can be expressed as a recursive generator producing rational approximations of arbitrary precision, making all mathematics computationally verifiable while maintaining logical consistency.
